lenders.name: Kathleen
lenders.loan_because: I really believe in the mission of Kiva. I'm a recent college graduate and can only make a small loan, but I think every little bit counts!

lenders.name: Liz
lenders.loan_because: I want to help people improve their quality of life.

lenders.name: Debra
lenders.loan_because: I have the resources to do so.
lenders.occupational_info: I teach high school kids about economics, government and history.

lenders.name: Arvin
lenders.loan_because: It's good to give :)

lenders.name: Karine
lenders.loan_because: it is easy and it can actually change lives

lenders.name: Amy
lenders.loan_because: How could I not?

lenders.name: Meridith
lenders.loan_because: It might spark peace and prosperity.  But at the very least, it makes a positive difference for someone working to improve her life.  And how could you say no to that?
lenders.occupational_info: I buy and sell souvenirs.  On kind of a large scale.

lenders.name: The Bakke family
lenders.loan_because: I want to help others around the world. Help them reach their goals and find their place in life which they were meant to do.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm retired and I love to paint and be with my family and I love to help others.

lenders.name: Kimberly
lenders.loan_because: I think it's a great way for individuals to make a real impact on reducing poverty.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm doing a degree in urban planning, so I'm interested in improving the quality of people's lives through strengthening communities and community organizations.

lenders.name: Helena

lenders.occupational_info: I work in a public company, from the Lisbon's Municipality, dealing with cultural management.

Alex - high school student

lenders.name: Brad & Kathryn
lenders.loan_because: A little goes a long way.

lenders.name: Amy & Tom

lenders.occupational_info: Amy works to get new drugs approved and available to those who need them; Tom designs systems for companies to store their information.

lenders.name: Island Women
lenders.loan_because: We loan because we can and it feels right.
lenders.occupational_info: We are a group of women mostly from New England who gather once a year on an island in Maine. We all work in professions that attempt to create a happier safer world for all.

lenders.name: reglindis
lenders.loan_because: my son and his wife surprised me with a gift certificate,

lenders.name: miriam
lenders.loan_because: I am grateful to help.

lenders.name: Lisa T (for the 32)

lenders.name: Susan

lenders.occupational_info: I currently work for a global retailer which has significant impact on communities throughout the world.

lenders.name: Derek
lenders.loan_because: I can, and it's worth doing something to help.

lenders.name: Ute
lenders.loan_because: Because a little help is better than none.
lenders.occupational_info: I want to help women to become independent

lenders.name: Christian
lenders.loan_because: Because if we don't , who will?

lenders.name: Dirk
lenders.loan_because: i can.
lenders.occupational_info: internet design, advertising.

lenders.name: Elizabeth and Jeff
lenders.loan_because: I think women having their own business is empowering.  I thoroughly endorse the entrepreneurial spirit.
lenders.occupational_info: Retired from the construction industry.  Now volunteer at the Alliance Française in Chicago.

lenders.name: Rich and Lana
lenders.occupation: Both retired: elections clerk & news officer
lenders.loan_because: we believe we're all in this together.

lenders.name: Geetha
lenders.occupational_info: I help to manufacture soaps and cleaners.

lenders.name: Paul
lenders.loan_because: Governments helping people never seems to work.  People helping people works.
lenders.occupational_info: I set up and maintain information technology machines for legal firms.

lenders.name: Jack
lenders.loan_because: I want to help other people help themselves and those around them.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a student going into 7th grade at Catholic School.

lenders.name: Mark
lenders.loan_because: As an entrepreneur I know how vital access to capital can be. Such access can be extremely limited for small borrowers who may have little or no credit history or business experience. Given a chance, most of these small borrowers will succeed, and I'm grateful I'm able to help make these folks' dreams come true.
lenders.occupational_info: I owned and operated a retail photography equipment and supplies store until I retired.

lenders.name: Eddi ;-)
lenders.loan_because: weil es spaß macht menschen zu helfen :-)

lenders.name: ken
lenders.loan_because: only a life lived for others is a life worthwile - a. einstein
lenders.occupational_info: writing computer programs

lenders.name: Sean & Meghan
lenders.loan_because: ...for reasons political, social, economic, but most importantly, spiritual.  Christ has blessed us (not to mention the rest of the U.S.) with more than we could ever need.  For this, we share...
lenders.occupational_info:
Chemical Engineer (him)
Electronic Media & ART+Design (her)

lenders.name: Tim, Meg, Scout, Quinn
lenders.loan_because: "Man should not consider his material possessions his own, but as common to all, so as to share them without hesitation when others are in need."  St. Thomas Aquinas
lenders.occupational_info: We are teachers who are trying to bring awareness of the world to our students and parents who are trying to do the same with our children.

lenders.name: Omar Rezec
lenders.loan_because: I want to positively impact the human condition in the world and make the world a better place.

lenders.name: Sarah Ivey
lenders.loan_because: I believe that we all live in one world.
lenders.occupational_info: I help businesses advertise to people in the right places at the right times.

lenders.name: John & Cindy

lenders.name: Brad

lenders.occupational_info: I help manage telecommunication projects across Australia.

lenders.name: Jill
lenders.loan_because: I've overcome the financial challenges of divorce and job lay offs, and the fear of not having enough. I loan to help others achieve financial security and the great feeling of personal accomplishment of their goals.

lenders.name: Jennifer
lenders.loan_because: if I were the one who needed the loan, I know you would lend to me.

lenders.name: Tzedakahman
lenders.loan_because: It is the right thing to do.  Everyone deserves the opportunity to make a living with dignity and honor.
lenders.occupational_info: I work on a social network that is designed to empower the next generation to learn and experience the giving of charity, from a meaningful perspective, based on Jewish values as we all learn to become more thoughtful in our relationships to society.

lenders.name: Deb, Sam & Bianca
lenders.loan_because: It makes us happy to see others pursue dreams which are otherwise beyond reach.
lenders.occupational_info: Deb - Biosecurity Officer; Sam - 11yrs, Bianca -9yrs, both at school.

lenders.name: Tiffany
lenders.loan_because: God has blessed me and so I want to help other however I can.

lenders.name: Stephanie
lenders.loan_because: 25 dollars goes a long way!

lenders.name: The Andrea Family
lenders.loan_because: poverty doesn't need to happen - there is plenty for all.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a student (studying nursing)and a mother and Brendan is a software engineer

lenders.name: Jane
lenders.loan_because: Its such an easy thing to do, to help someone across the world.
lenders.occupational_info: I am an animal doctor in a small country town.

lenders.name: Thomas & Mette
lenders.loan_because: We have never believed in just giving money to someone. Lend them the money and they will feel a greater responsibility. We want to help the women, they need a break. Besides... in africa the men have been in charge for 50 years, with little luck. Time to let the women have a go at it :-)
lenders.occupational_info: Thomas is in charge of the servers that run the Copenhagen City (Capital of Denmark and host of the COP15 summit) website. Mette is a distribution manager in the danish postal service.

lenders.name: Niels & Petra
lenders.loan_because: Sometimes we all need some extra money to make the next step...

lenders.name: Milus
lenders.loan_because: So many people are in need of just a little help to make a living.
lenders.occupational_info: Ever since I joined Kiva in July 2008, I've been able to reinvest my original donation multiple times. It just goes on and on and on... due to the effort  of these hard working entrepreneurs and, of course,  the Kiva staff. During 2012 I will keep donating in their honour.

lenders.name: Yuko
lenders.loan_because: it is wonderful that I can be of help to people who are working hard on the other side of the globe.

lenders.name: Mario
lenders.loan_because: A Framework for Global Prosperity would be possible only with global solidarity
lenders.occupational_info: I manage several construction projects in South America and Israel.

lenders.name: Carol & Dave
lenders.loan_because: It's the absolute best use of $25 I can think of :).

lenders.name: Silke and AGG
lenders.loan_because: We are a peer-group (gender equality) and work together in Hannover. We want to give other groups a chance - especially women - to build up their business.

lenders.name: Stephen
lenders.loan_because: I want to help others and give a little back.

lenders.name: M. Diane Rogers
lenders.loan_because: I believe we can each make a difference in the world.
lenders.occupational_info: Usually I am helping others learn about their family history. Very satisfying.

lenders.name: Geoffrey
lenders.loan_because: Many people have helped me in my life.  In turn, I need to take every opportunity to do the same for others.  Loaning money in this way is easy and rewarding.

lenders.name: Shawna
lenders.loan_because: I would like to connect with women and men around the globe and learn their stories and hear about their success. I am interested in helping other women who sew or make things.  I visted Guatemala in 1992 with Habitat for Humanity  while I was in college and had wonderful experiences and met beautiful, happy people.  They all had very little material goods and were the most generous people I've ever met.
lenders.occupational_info: I design rooms and also sew, build and paint.  I like to work with my hands building and creating beautiful interiors.

lenders.name: Monique
lenders.loan_because: I think it is a great way to help people improve their lives themselves.

lenders.name: Adam
lenders.loan_because: I believe together we can help ordinary people like ourselves who simply need a chance.  I want to help give them that chance if at all possible.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm a sailor in the U.S. Navy.  I do a lot of research and analytical work as I travel.

lenders.name: Temu, A.B.S
lenders.loan_because: This is my small contribution to social enterprising, with particular interest to projects in Africa. There are enough resources including finances in this world to facilitate enough projects to create sustainable growth and wealth. There isn't enough grass roots people organizations to facilitate knowledge seeking, acquiring, sharing topped with appropriate timely actions on knowledge acquired -  well organized to adequately utilize and access relevant resources. Kiva contributes as a Platform working towards creating a world without Poverty. A noble cause, many of us will attempt to associate ourselves with.
lenders.occupational_info: Strong passion on the use of technology towards any efforts attributing to wealth and value creation and grassroots empowerment through knowledge sharing/dissemination & cooperation.

lenders.name: Jeff David
lenders.loan_because: I never had to want for anything... so this is my way of paying it forward.
lenders.occupational_info: I work as an ISO standards auditor.

lenders.name: Maya
lenders.loan_because: I was given a Kiva gift certificate for my high school graduation, and I am excited to begin making contributions.  This micro-loan organization is a wonderful cause, and I look forward to helping those in need all across the globe.

lenders.name: Susan Reid
lenders.loan_because: Some debts you can't pay off, so you pay them forward.
lenders.occupational_info: I design websites and print materials for people starting their own businesses.

lenders.name: Haley
lenders.loan_because: I believe that individuals can make a difference.

lenders.name: ker
lenders.loan_because: i have a social consciousness and i am aware of the fact that i was lucky to be born in a richer part of the world.

lenders.name: Stacy & Dan
lenders.loan_because: We enjoy giving, and helping; it brings us great happiness to help others achieve their dreams.
lenders.occupational_info: We are professional writers, working in partnership, specializing in writing stories to be made into Hollywood movies.   We love what we do, and feel blessed that we get to work together as husband and wife.

lenders.name: K Gill
lenders.loan_because: We are all human, and all deserve the chance to build a life free from poverty, hunger, and fear.
lenders.occupational_info: I help developmentally disabled children make the most of their educational opportunities.

lenders.name: Laura
lenders.loan_because: it's a very small way that I can help fellow humans navigate life on this planet.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with students ages 5-11 who are struggling to learn to read English.

lenders.name: Jessica
lenders.loan_because: I want to empower people to make their dreams come true!
lenders.occupational_info: I work in the convention and visitors bureau industry on the development side.

lenders.name: Kieran
lenders.loan_because: everybody deserves opportunities, but unfortunately not everyone gets them

lenders.name: Arthur
lenders.loan_because: I enjoy seeing others have an opportunity to succeed.

lenders.name: Jennifer
lenders.loan_because: It's great to help people help themselves, their families, and communities. I admire the hard work and determination it takes for people to make their business grow!

lenders.name: Carol
lenders.loan_because: these micro loans provide an advantage to people they wouldn't otherwise have. I'm happy to be able to help others in need.

lenders.name: One Planet Catering
lenders.loan_because: We feel privileged to be doing the things we love by having the freedom and opportunities in which to do them, that's why 5% of our revenue will go to the two things that need the same opportunities to flourish and grow - people and our planet. In our communities, we're excited about the vegetable roots that will grow in the gardens of preschools and elementary schools while establishing roots for healthy eating habits in children and our school systems. We also look forward to support micro-financing opportunities in developing nations through KIVA
lenders.occupational_info: “ONE PLANET CATERING” is the leading environmental and social responsible catering company in Vancouver with the primary focus on serving lunch to people at work. We encourage our customers to make positive choices for their wellbeing and the environment, at the same time provide them with information on nutrition and current food-related/ environmental issues. By delivering natural, organic lunches, we increase our customers' health, energy and productivity.

lenders.name: Susan
lenders.loan_because: Kiva feels like a good way to do something positive.
lenders.occupational_info: I am self-employed and write for advertising agencies, mostly for Web sites, but also anything else a business might need (like brochures or print ads). I usually just tell people I "rearrange the alphabet." For my own pleasure I write fiction and poetry.

lenders.name: Nanci and Jeff
lenders.loan_because: My son gave me the gift of giving
lenders.occupational_info: I help families that are dealing with disabilities find the services they need and advocate for them along the way.

lenders.occupational_info:
SPARSE!
When I'm working, which isn't steady, I'm a sound and video engineer for NY network television. If you can see it and hear it, there's someone like me providing that quality video and sound.

lenders.name: Elizabeth
lenders.loan_because: This loan is in honor of my mother Elizabeth Kwiker (pictured). She had a generous spirit and loved to help others. She traveled through Asia and loved the kind people and beatiful countries.

lenders.name: Patty
lenders.loan_because: I want to help those who want to help themselves and who believe, as I do, in hard work, determination and their ability to make things happen.   I am happy to help in my small way to give them a chance to succeed.
lenders.occupational_info: I make beaded jewelry and sell it at shows and markets in the eastern US.

lenders.name: Jay
lenders.loan_because: there is a need

lenders.name: Alice
lenders.loan_because: I believe that people want to provide for themselves and I loan because it is an opportunity to remove financial barriers that can help them to achieve indepedence.

lenders.loan_because: I want to help others

lenders.name: Thomas
lenders.loan_because: To make a difference.

lenders.name: Alison and Mike
lenders.loan_because: This makes me feel like I'm connecting with people more directly.  I'm helping a neighbor.
lenders.occupational_info: I have a store where I sell furniture and help my customers make beautiful homes to live in.  My parents started the business 40 years ago and I have run it for almost 30 years.  We are a small family business of 6 employees including myself and my husband.

lenders.name: The Lassaline Family
lenders.loan_because: we have been lucky enough to have been born in a prosperous country where a middle class lifestyle is easy to obtain. Our children and our community need to understand this and help those willing to work hard and work beyond the barriers that hold them down.

lenders.name: Carol
lenders.loan_because: Every little bit helps!

lenders.name: Alexander
lenders.loan_because: I believe in people helping people.

lenders.loan_because: Why not?

lenders.name: Timothy
lenders.loan_because: I want to give back
lenders.occupational_info: I don't feel like I make an impact.  It's a job.

lenders.occupational_info: alll types of famous faces of people that help me be in the white light. They warm my heart and mind.When I had nothing. People keep me alive.

lenders.loan_because: I believe it's a solution

lenders.name: Jacob
lenders.loan_because:
I have no other opportunities. Here is the long story in a short version: 

When I was 15 I woke up one morning at my Girlfriend, at that time, and I had this strange feeling inside, wondering what it was, I walked over to the window, it was summer and my Girlfriend was still a sleep in the bed. I'll never forget this feeling in my stomach, this weird, unknown, new and very disturbing feeling.

Now, before I go any further, I know what some may think, that this is a nice little sad story I'm making up so I can get people to loan me the money, but no, it is not! I can absolutely guarantee you that it is not, I can even get medical papers and bank papers and so on, confirming all of it in hard facts, at least showing that it really happened and so forth!

But back to my story, the story of my life, I've told it like a million times. 

There I was, that morning, only 15 years old, not knowing what was happening inside of me, just that something was going on, something not quite right. But as the days went by and I kept feeling this way, I realized that it wasn't going to go away on its own, it was there to stay and it made me so depressed, unsecure and I felt like shit, unworthy to live, had no desire to live!!! But what the hell was this feeling? 

I am born and raised in a small town in Denmark. A small town, where people know everybody, here you don't show your weakness, where you don't talk about your feelings. So as a young boy aged 15-16 years, I had a very difficult time dealing with this new feeling, not knowing what to do, whom to tell, where to go….

The summer vacation was over and I was going to new school with a lot of people I didn't know, with this feeling inside, I just felt so ashamed of it, not knowing what it was, I had hided it inside of me, hadn't talked to anyone about it, because I thought it would go away on its own, but no. 
So I went on, and it was eating me up, things not being dealt with have a tendency to go in some very wrong directions. And oh boy was I heading in one hell of a wrong direction: 

After almost 4-5 month at the new school I had made a lot of trouble, because I wasn't feeling happy inside and I could just feel this weird, wrong, depressing feeling and that made me do foolish boy pranks, which was interpetated like simple, but not acceptable boy pranks, when it indeed was about a boy who was feeling like he was going to die, insane, weird and on the brink of wanting to die! I've wished myself dead at least a 100 times, at least! 

How do you explain to someone, that you have this weird feeling inside, that makes you feel insane, that makes you confused and totally unsecure, that brings you down, not even knowing why or being able to connect it to anything AT ALL! Just overnight, that summer morning? 

So I didn't know at all how to talk or tell anyone about it, I felt to ashamed and no adults took me by the arm and really took an upright interest in me as a human being worth saving, so the teachers just gave me a choice, either get your shit together or leave this school!

I left, as I have left a 100 other times since then, because of that feeling! That fucking unknown shitty feeling, eating me up inside! Making my personality totally different!

I found out, that this feeling was coming and going, without a pattern. But it became very clear, that the feeling or as I like to call it, the condition, was dominating me at all times, there wasn't one night or day, where I wasn't thinking about it, it became my life. Avoid being seen, because I had this feeling, which made me low, depressed, gave me a feeling of not being myself, felt insane, couldn't feel anything, wanted to die, couldn't think very clear, all those effects of the condition made me hide, how or what would you do, if you felt like there was something unknown, an unexplained condition dominating you, making you feel like this and you had found out, that it didn't go away on its own, it just kept on coming in different degrees and without a pattern or a real reason, would you feel ashamed of yourself? Would you hide yourself, because how could you be social and feeling like this at the same time!?

So I hid myself away, from everybody! Even my family! 

It was about 1 year since I woke up that morning, with that condition. I felt like I had to try and talk to my parents, so I (16 years old) I told my parents one day, that I had something I needed to tell them and that I would like it if they would come with me into the living room and hear what I had to say!
So we sat down and I could see in their eyes, that they were a little afraid of the whole situation, like there was something serious wrong. 
So I told them how I felt, it was very hard and I didn't feel comfortable in the situation at all, hence the condition and all was there and affecting me! 
My mom's reaction was "Is this really something you mean, do YOU REALLY!!!! MEAN IT?  
It made me sad and afraid, that my mom would react like that, my own parents, that are supposed to back me up and help me and worst of all, my dad just sad there, looking out into the thin air. 
So I felt even more unsecure about myself and said to my parents, that it was probably just me and my mind, just a teenage thing, thou I knew it wasn't, because I felt like shit, I wanted to die, I had never felt that bad in my entire life! NEVER! My parents didn't even ask me afterwards about that day or how I felt, it made me furious and from that day on I was going to make it on my own!

So nothing happened. Later on I found out, that my dad's mom, my grandmother had cancer and that he had just gotten message about she wasn't going to beat the cancer. That's why he didn't say anything that day. And my mom was defending my dad, or was to stressed out because of the cancer situation, that she reacted that way. I also found out they owed quite a lot for the house and that it was tuff times. 
Phew =) It's a long story and I just wanted to tell the short version. 

The condition went on, I kept hiding myself, floating away from my own true me and began to put a mask on, at every event, in every social situation I pretended like I was okay and so on, although I wanted to die and I hadn't talked to anybody about this feeling/condition for almost 1½ year at this time in the story. 

Time had come where I had to decide what I was going to do, study or work. I just wanted to die! I felt like the whole world had chosen me and just wanted me to kill myself, because why would anybody, without a reason, want to do this to somebody who was happy and loved life from before that morning aged 15? 

So I did what all my friends did or what most of them did, I went to business school, 3 year education. Today it is mystery how I managed those years, because never had I had a harder time, than those 3 years. It was a very troublesome time and I completely lost my identity and the Jacob I used to be was gone. I was now a hollow actor, a living dead walking around and trying not to be seen! It was a living hell!
At my third year, I had a my final big project and I decided to write about depression, because I thought that was it! I wanted people to read it and ask me about how I felt, but no one did… I even wrote in it, that I thought I had a depression and I asked my parents to read it. They did, but they didn't even ask me about anything or commented on it. I was petrified!!!

I barely made the examines and I got through those 3 years with a very bad grade on my papers. But I did learn some and that has helped me in my life!  

The years went by and the condition was still there, the acting was still there, the wanting to die was still there! Nothing had changed, oh, yeah, one thing had changed, I had almost accepted the condition and decided to live with it, like that, be miserable, sad and wanting to die, yes, I didn't see any other way….. When not even my own parents wanted to see or hear me, even help me, I couldn't see any way out!

So as amazing as it may seem, I went through ca. 7 years with that condition, without talking to anyone, yeah, I talked to 1 girlfriend about it, but she was the girlfriend I had back that morning, when I woke up and the feeling was there. I lost her because of that condition and all my friends back then and I would even say I lost my own family, because they ignored me. I just sad by the diner table for 7 years, eating, listening to my mom, dad and brother talking, not seeing what condition I was in, not saying or asking if I was okay, not even once!!!!!!!!!!!! I wouldn't want to wish even my worst or most hated enemy to experience 7 years like that, I have NO IDEA how I made it! Do we have a choice, we have to live or else we have to take our own life and I could never do that, since I knew how good life could be!!

At my 7th year into the condition I was really at an edged, I had moved to Denmark's second biggest city Arhus, I believe you know the capital Copenhagen? And I was going to study computer programming for 2½ years and get an education. But I didn't want to do that, I just applied for the education so no one would see me, so they wouldn't see my condition, because they didn't help me or say anything, thou they could see how I was every day, I think they may have turned the blind eye or was to afraid to act on something that serious. Which is worst, I don't know. People turning the blind eye seeing and knowing how bad and sick I was or not seeing me at all, because, well, because what do I know? Because they didn't really see me, or cared about my life and well being.

To make the story even shorter, I started at the computer programming school, but had to drop out, because the condition/feeling was eating me up! 
After that day I went to see my doctor in Århus, for the first time in 7 years living with that all-dominating condition I went to a doctor to do something about it, to find out, I was at the brink of suicide and I was willing to do anything. It was a very bad doctor and he just gave me some pills and said that everything was going  to be okay. In my condition I would do anything, I hadn't done anything for 7 years, so I took the pills. They made me feel like shit and a zombie. I went to the officials and made them help me, they put me on welfare and wanted me to get into treatment. so I did! 

I went off the pills after a year and in the meantime I had met a girl, I thought she was the sweetest girl ever, I thought she wanted to do what was best for me, but instead she lied to me and said the had a lot of money, that she had this and that, I didn't care, just as long as we loved each other. It ended after 2 years of lies and me believing in her lies, it was so hard, and the condition/feeling was STILL THERE! I went to a psychiatrist, but because of that girlfriend it didn't go through, I just stayed away, because the girlfriend had lied about her money and made me sign a loan, she said that her lawyer would pay her the money later on, when she was old enough to receive her heritage, 2 millions. I belived her, if you do not belive in your partner, then what do you have? When all is left, all we have are each other, common sense and so on, but she was a master at lies, she manipulated me and my sickness. 

The relationship ended and because of her I now owed 12500 dollars to my bank, and I had gotten absolutely nothing for those money. I just couldn't believe it! Before I met this deceiving and disturbing young woman, I had send a letter to my parents explain how mad and disappointed I was over their behavior over the last 7 years. 

8 years had passed and I wrote to them that I didn't want to talk or see them for some while! They had never helped me or even asked me. They had a mental breakdown and went to see a psychiatrist themselves. I didn't see or exchange even 1 word with them for 8 month and then I decided that it was time to put the past behind me and try to look forward, no good would come of not talking to them.

So here I am, 10 years later, aged 25. Still fighting that very same feeling/condition from that morning. Not knowing what it is, but this time I got one hell of a lot of experience with us human beings, I have used the last 10 years in the school of life, observing how we treat each other and how miserable a lot of us are. It is a very sad sight and not for the fainted hearted. So in one way you can say, that it has given me an awareness like no one else and a knowledge about a lot of things, that "normal" people don't have, because they have been living in the life, while I was participating, acting, and quietly observing from within.

I used a lot of those years ordering online, reading a lot about technology and the development. I know a lot about this and that's why I came to this place, because I need start capital for my very own webshop, where I will be selling electronical goods to the whole wide world, quality at low prices, I want to break the market and fill out the gaps that are there, suit the needs of consumers, that I have experienced needs it. So I am hoping, that you will realize and see that I am very well for real, I have the purest intentions and I would give my right arm to have my first success in 10 years, still fighting this feeling/condition. I have come a long way, but I still don't know what it is and it is killing me, so I am VERY excited about this time I have at the psychiatrist in August. That is the first time in aprox 2 years since I was with that girl who lied and made the last, and at that time, first visit with a psychiatrist go wrong and out in the sand. 

So I beg of you, trust me, and I will pay you back with interest! Ask me about everything you want and I will try and answer you at best will! If you do not trust me or believe that this is the story of my life, well, then I feel sorry for you. If we do not trust in each other and in life, then we have no fundament here in life, it all depends on corporation and other people! Together we can do everything, alone we will die and parish, its as simple as that!

All my best wishes to everybody out there =)
lenders.occupational_info: I am developing ideas and are a very creative  person. Right now I am trying to find the money to make the webshop I have been planning and working on for ages. If I could find the capital for this, it would change my life and I have had one hell of a life!

lenders.name: Bob Stein
lenders.loan_because:
I loan because ... I don't qualify to borrow?  I can't say why exactly I'm here.  I do intend to make up a good reason eventually.  I feel much the same about life, since my application to incarnate as a storm petrel was denied.  Sorry, should I be taking this space more seriously?  I guess I have that problem in life too. 

Since I came to Kiva I feel a little less overwhelmed, help my friends and family a little more, waste less, whine less.

I look for projects that create value as opposed to mere reselling.  I try to favor lower interest rates.  I love a good story.  I notice a recurring food theme, maybe I was hungry when I picked those.

You may wonder why most of the people in the pictures below are smiling, while my picture on the left, not so much.  You might think this is because Kiva has taken my money and given it to them, and you would have a point.  Except the pictures were all taken before that happened.  I like to believe it's because they are cuter when they smile.
lenders.occupational_info: I write, print, and sell cheat-sheets and posters for web designers, in 95 countries so far.  I have four kids, ages 15-24.  Sometimes they help, but each year it seems they want more money and can run faster.

lenders.name: Laura and Jamison
lenders.loan_because: We want to help many people's lives and give them the opportunity to make their dreams come true.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a Kindergarten teacher in a public school in NYC.  My husband is a veterinarian at an emergency animal hospital in NJ.

lenders.name: Bobby

lenders.name: Kate
lenders.loan_because: I feel that it's important to help other people to get started with their life because you never know someday you might be in the same position and need this loan to get you started as well.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a student.  Honestly, my job title is student but I babysit all the time so that's my income.

"The message I would leave . . .  is We can and we've got to do better than this."
 - Ted Geisel

It's a small thing on my end that can possibly help someone else so much.

lenders.occupational_info: I have two jobs: As an urban planner, I work with others to make cities better. I also translate from French to English.
